Learn What it takes to be a Web Developer in 2020

What would you be doing as a Back End Developer

Back End Developer

  • Server Side Language
    • Node.js - JavaScript runtime which enables JS to be used as a Server Side Language
    • Python
    • PHP
    • C#
    • Ruby usually with Ruby On Rails framework
    • GoLang
    • Java
    • Rust,C and C++ is used with Web Assembly
    • Courses on Youtube
      • Node.js Crash Course
      • Python Crash Course
      • PHP Front to back
      • C# Project in 60 seconds
      • Go Crash Course
      • Rust Crash Course
  • Server Side Framework
    • Node.js - Express, Koa, Adonis, Feather.js, Nest.js
    • PHP - Laravel, Symfony, Slim
    • Python - Django, Flask
    • C# - ASP.NET MVC
    • Java - Spring MVC, Grails
    • Ruby - Ruby on Rails, Sinatra
    • GoLang - Revel
    • Courses on Youtube
      • Express Crash Course
      • Koa Crash Course
      • Adonis Crash Course
      • Django Crash Course
      • Flask series
      • Laravel Series
      • Symfony Series
      • Ruby On Rails Course
  • Database
    • Relational Database - PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL
    • NoSQL - MongoDB, RethinkDB, CouchDB
    • Cloud Database - Firebase, Azure Cloud DB, AWS
    • Lightweight & Cache - Redis, SQLite, NeDB
    • Courses on Youtube
      • MySQL Crash Course
      • MongoDB Crash Course
      • Redis Crash Course
      • intro To NoSQL
      • RethinkDB Crash Course
  • GraphQL - query language for your API
    • Single endpoint to ask for only what you want
    • Symple Syntax, similar to JSON
    • Fairly easy to implement
    • Apollo is a client to interact with the GraphQL server
    • Courses on Youtube
      • Build a GraphQL Server
      • App with React, Apollo adn GraphQL
  • CMS - Used to add content to your website/ application
    • Traditional CMS - Wordpress, Drupal, Keystone, Enduro
    • Headless CMS(Mainly to only work on data on website) - Contentful, Prismic.io, Sanity, Strapi
    • Courses on Youtube
      • Wordpress site 1 hour
      • Wordpress REST API
      • Keystone Crash Course
  • Deployment & DevOps - create/manage environments and deploy to the web
    • SSH (Secure Shell)
    • Web Server Environment -NGINX, Apache
    • App Hosting- Lincode, Heroku, AWS, Azure, Now
    • Virtualization - Docker, Vagrant
    • Testing - unit, Functional, Integration etc
    • Load Balancing, Monitoring, Security etc
    • Courses on Youtube
      • SSH Crash Course
      • Node.js Deployment with NGINX
      • Getting started with Docker
      • Vagrant crash Course
      • Jest testing

Back End Wizard

  • Familiar with a popular Server Side langauge and framework
  • Setup dev environemnts and workflows
  • Build Backend Apps, APIs, microservices
  • Work with Databases, SQL, ORMs
  • Manage application and component level stateDeploy to production(SSH, Git, Cloud etc)
